overallSummary: Fabio Giglietto maintains an active presence across Mastodon, LinkedIn, and Bluesky, primarily sharing research-related updates, publications, and opportunities within the field of computational social science, particularly focusing on disinformation and information operations. While LinkedIn boasts the largest follower count, engagement varies across platforms.

contentThemes.description: Sharing published papers, research findings, and new tools related to computational social science and disinformation studies.
Announcing openings for postdoctoral researchers and PhD students within the research team.
Sharing information about upcoming conference presentations and participation in academic discussions.
Announcing new grants awarded for research projects.

recommendations: Diversify content types to include visuals (images/videos) to enhance engagement.
Increase posting frequency on platforms with lower engagement rates.
Use platform-specific hashtags to broaden reach and increase discoverability.
Actively participate in conversations and respond to comments to foster a stronger community.

platformInsights.bluesky: Bluesky shows decent engagement with a focus on research publications and research opportunities. Reposts are a significant driver of engagement on this platform.
platformInsights.mastodon: Mastodon has the lowest follower count and engagement. Content should be tailored to the platform's community, potentially focusing on open-source tools and research discussions.
platformInsights.linkedin: LinkedIn has the largest follower base and highest engagement, likely due to the professional networking context. Content related to grants, hiring, and team achievements performs well.

topPerformingContent.content: Excited to announce that our research team has been awarded a new grant to study information operations across social media platforms.

Now hiring: Two postdoctoral researchers to join our team working on computational methods for social media analysis. Background in data science, computational social science, or related fields preferred.
Just published our new paper on coordinated inauthentic behavior on social media platforms!
